Description of incident: A password-protected laptop computer              containing personal information for current and former Indiana State              University students was stolen. The laptop contained data for students              who took economics classes from 1997 through the spring semester 2008.              The information includes names, grades, e-mail addresses and student              identification numbers and in some cases Social Security numbers.              UPDATE(7/22/08) :The              laptop computer was mailed anonymously back to the professor it was              stolen from six days after it was stolen along with other personal              items.
